channel.title: Context Engineering Daily
channel.description: Daily news and research updates in AI Context Engineering, Prompt Engineering, RAG, and LLM development

item.title: Teaching People LLM's Errors and Getting it Right
item.description: arXiv:2512.21422v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: People use large language models (LLMs) when they should not. This is partly because they see LLMs compose poems and answer intricate questions, so they understandably, but incorrectly, assume LLMs won't stumble on basic tasks like simple arithmetic. ...<br><br><small><strong>Source:</strong> arXiv | <strong>Keywords:</strong> arxiv, paper, study, analysis, prompting | <strong>Relevance:</strong> 100%</small>
item.author: noreply@contextengineering.news (arXiv)

item.title: Morality is Contextual: Learning Interpretable Moral Contexts from Human Data with Probabilistic Clustering and Large Language Models
item.description: arXiv:2512.21439v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Moral actions are judged not only by their outcomes but by the context in which they occur. We present COMETH (Contextual Organization of Moral Evaluation from Textual Human inputs), a framework that integrates a probabilistic context learner with LLM...<br><br><small><strong>Source:</strong> arXiv | <strong>Keywords:</strong> arxiv, RAG, prompting, prompt, large language model | <strong>Relevance:</strong> 100%</small>

item.title: Oogiri-Master: Benchmarking Humor Understanding via Oogiri
item.description: arXiv:2512.21494v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Humor is a salient testbed for human-like creative thinking in large language models (LLMs). item.title: A Unified Definition of Hallucination, Or: It's the World Model, Stupid
item.description: arXiv:2512.21577v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Despite numerous attempts to solve the issue of hallucination since the inception of neural language models, it remains a problem in even frontier large language models today. Why is this the case? We walk through definitions of hallucination used in ...<br><br><small><strong>Source:</strong> arXiv | <strong>Keywords:</strong> arxiv, knowledge base, context, large language model, model | <strong>Relevance:</strong> 100%</small>

item.title: Gamayun's Path to Multilingual Mastery: Cost-Efficient Training of a 1.5B-Parameter LLM
item.description: arXiv:2512.21580v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We present Gamayun, a 1.5B-parameter multilingual language model trained entirely from scratch on 2.5T tokens. item.description: arXiv:2512.21635v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Hallucinations in large language models (LLMs) are commonly regarded as errors to be minimized. item.title: KAG - KAG is a logical form-guided reasoning and retrieval framework based on OpenSPG engine and LLMs. It is used to build logical reasoning and factual Q&A solutions for professional domain knowledge bases. It can effectively overcome the shortcomings of the traditional RAG vector similarity calculation model.
item.description: KAG is a logical form-guided reasoning and retrieval framework based on OpenSPG engine and LLMs. It is used to build logical reasoning and factual Q&A solutions for professional domain knowledge bases.
